template.name: ID Only
template.title: ID Only Template

lkl.title: NFC-A and NFC-B - ISO/IEC 14443 types A and B
NFC-A, NFC-B and NFC-V - ISO/IEC 14443 types A and B and ISO/IEC 15693
Inside Secure PicoTag (including HID iClass), protocol B
Inside Secure PicoTag (including HID iClass), protocol V

template.description: The ID Only Template is the basic Template to read a card or tag's protocol-level IDentifier. Pay attention that such IDs may easily be cloned or spoofed, and that NFC mobile phones as well as modern, privacy-concerned card solutions, use random protocol-level IDentifiers, that would change all the time.

option.title: Do not invert ID bytes (the ID is transmitted "as is")
Invert ID bytes for short (4-byte) ISO/IEC 14443 type A IDs
Invert ID bytes for all kind of IDs

field.title: Padding if ID is shorted than specified length
field.name: Padding if ID is shorted than specified length

option.title: Read only the ID (UID-A, PUPI, etc)
Read all the protocol bytes (ATQ-A, ATQ-B, etc)

field.title: Shift Bytes
field.name: Shift Bytes
field.description: Leading bytes to suppress.

field.title: Shift Bits
field.name: Shift Bits
field.description: Leading bits to suppress; valid range is `0` to `7`.

register.title: Options
register.description: If this register is set, the Reader adds a token to its output to tell the receiver what kind of credential has been read.

field.title: Position of the Card Type Token
field.name: Position of the Card Type Token

option.title: After the Prefix, before the Data

field.title: Add a Card Type Token to the output stream?
field.name: Card Type Token

option.title: Do not add a Card Type Token
Add a **numerical** (hex) value as Card Type Token.
Add a **char** as Card Type Token.

register.title: Prefix
register.description: A Template-specific Prefix, that is added after the Reader's global Prefix.
register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

template.title: 7816-4 Template

lkl.title: ISO-DEP on NFC-A and NFC-B - ISO/IEC 14443-4 'T=CL' types A and B
ISO-DEP on NFC-A - ISO/IEC 14443-4 'T=CL' type A
ISO-DEP on NFC-B - ISO/IEC 14443-4 'T=CL' type B

template.description: ISO/IEC 7816-4 is the standard for smart card commands. Most contactless smartcards use the ISO/IEC 7816-4 on top of a ISO/IEC 14443-4 'T=CL' or "ISO-DEP" communication channel. According to this standard, the card is structured as a (lightweight) file-system, providing Directory Files and Elementary Files. The standard-defined Instruction-set allows to navigate in the smartcard's directories and file tree, and to read the data from its files. Every Instruction call is named an "APDU". The card's Response to every Instruction is always terminated by a 2-B Status Word which denotes the success (values `9xxx`, typically `9000`) or the failure (values `6xxx`). Using this ISO/IEC 7816-4 Template, the Reader is able to send 1, 2 or 3 APDUs and to extract the data from the card's last Response.
template.remark: This Template is suitable to read data on virtually any contactless smartcard, provided that said data is accessible in the plain and without prior authentication. Reading data from a secure smartcard (such as Desfire) or an NFC applications (such as Apple VAS and Google SmartTap) is possible only using a dedicated Template that implements both the application-specific security and Instruction-set at once.

register.title: 1st APDU
register.description: This is typically a SELECT APPLICATION or a SELECT DIRECTORY Instruction.
register.remark: The Reader checks the Status Word. In case of any error (SW!=`9xxx`), the Template is terminated.

register.title: 2nd APDU
register.description: This is typically a SELECT FILE Instruction.
register.remark: The Reader checks the Status Word. In case of any error (SW!=`9xxx`), the Template is terminated.

register.title: 3rd APDU
register.description: This is typically a READ BINARY or READ RECORD Instruction.
register.remark: The Reader checks the Status Word. In case of any error (SW!=`9xxx`), the Template is terminated.

template.name: NDEF Data

lkl.title: All NFC Forum Tags and SNEP peers (P2P mode)
NFC Forum type 4 Tags (T4T on NFC-A and NFC-B)
NFC Forum type 4A Tags (T4T on NFC-A only)
NFC Forum type 4B Tags (T4T on NFC-B only)

template.description: Use the NDEF Data Template to read the content of either a card formatted according to the NFC Forum Tag specification, or to receive a message through NFC beam (SNEP over LLCP).

register.title: Type Name and Format
register.description: Specify the TNF of the NDEF messages to accept. Messages with another TNF will be discarded.

field.title: Type Name and Format
field.description: TNF Filter

option.title: Read a Text (either a Well-known record with type `T` or a `text/plain` Media record)
Read an URI (either a Well-known record with type `U` or an Absolute URI record)
Read either a SpringCard data entry, a Text or an URI

register.title: Type Filter
register.description: Specify the actual Type of the NDEF Record you want to read. Please refer to the specifications of NFC Forum NDEF Data and Records, and to the specifications of the MIME Media, to provide a valid TNF+Type combination.
register.remark: This field is relevant only if TNF is either `01`, `02`, `03` or `04`; otherwise, its content is ignored.

register.description: Select the Desfire AID

field.remark: Leave empty or set to `000000` to use a plain GET VERSION command.

SAM AV, select key automatically (based on AID)

Value of DES/3DES or AES Secret Key

register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

template.name: Desfire File
template.title: Desfire File Template
template.description: Use the Desfire File Template to read data from a NXP Desfire PICC. The PICC could be either a Desfire EV0 or a Desfire EV1. The Reader may either * Read arbitrary data; the data will be transmitted in hexadecimal format. To do so, select the RAW mode in TOF register. * Read a number (decimal output). To do so, select the decimal mode in TOF register. * Read a string (ASCII-encoded data). To do so, select either the Short String or the Long String mode in TOF register. The target data is pointed to by an Application Identifier (AID) and a File Identifier. An offset within the file could be specified. The AID and the File Identifier are specified in the LOC register. Access to the file could involve a Mutual Authentication with the card, and the data could be transmitted either in plain, MACed/CMACed or ciphered modes. The key number, key value and communication mode are specified in the AUT register.

register.title: Location of Data
register.description: Select the Desfire AID, the File ID, and the offset/length parameters to read the file

field.title: Desfire Application ID (AID)
field.name: Application ID
field.remark: Valid range depends on the memory size of the actual PICC.
field.note: The number of pages to read is deduced from the expected length, as set in the TOF register.

field.title: Read Command
field.name: Read Command
field.remark: Desfire EV2 commands are supported only after version 1.30.

option.title: Read Data, `BD` (Standard Data File or Backup Data File, all card versions)
Read Data, `AD` (Standard Data File or Backup Data File, Desfire EV2 and EV3)
Read Record, `BB` (Linear Record File or Cyclic Record File, all card versions)
Read Record, `AB` (Linear Record File or Cyclic Record File, Desfire EV2 and EV3)

field.title: Read Offset or Record Number
field.name: Offset
field.description: For a Standard Data File or a Backup Data File, this is the offset inside the file For a Linear Record File or a Cyclic Record File, this is the record number

field.title: Read Length or Record Size
field.name: Length
field.description: For a Standard Data File or a Backup Data File, this is the Length parameter to be sent to the card. Set to `0` to read the while file at once. For a Linear Record File or a Cyclic Record File, this is the record size
field.remark: The Reader's internal buffer is limited to 256 bytes. Do not set to `0` if the file in the card is likely to be greater than this limit.

field.title: Shift Bytes
field.name: Shift Bytes
field.description: Leading bytes to suppress.

field.title: Shift Bits
field.name: Shift Bits
field.description: Leading bits to suppress; valid range is `0` to `7`.

field.title: Key Index inside the Desfire Application
field.name: Key Index

option.title: Key is specified in the Template
SAM AV, select key automatically (based on AID)
SAM AV, key slot is specified

field.title: Key slot in the internal SAM AV
Value of DES/3DES or AES Secret Key

register.title: Options
register.description: This register defines the transport protocol and the behaviour of the Reader during the handshaking. It is also possible for the Reader to add a token to its output, to tell the receiver what kind of credential has been read.

option.title: Use ISO 7816 Wrapping of Desfire commands

field.title: Position of the Card Type Token
field.name: Position of the Card Type Token

option.title: After the Prefix, before the Data

field.title: Add a Card Type Token to the output stream?
field.name: Card Type Token

Add `71` hex value as Card Type Token
Add `D` char as Card Type Token

register.description: A Template-specific Prefix, that is added after the Reader's global Prefix.
register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

template.name: Mifare UltraLight
template.title: Mifare UltraLight Template
template.description: Use the Mifare UltraLight Template to read data from a PICC within the NXP Mifare UltraLight family (including Mifare UltraLight EV1, Mifare UltraLight C, NTAG203, NTAG213, and virtually all other chips in the NTAG family). Any PICC compliant with the NFC Forum Type 2 Tag specification may also be read using this template (but the Reader will not decode the NFC Forum NDEF data when this template is choosen). The Reader may either * Read arbitrary data; the data will be transmitted in hexadecimal format. To do so, select the RAW mode in TOF register. * Read a number (decimal output). To do so, select the decimal mode in TOF register. * Read a string (ASCII-encoded data). To do so, select either the Short String or the Long String mode in TOF register. The target data is pointed to by an absolute page number (yet the data may occupy more than one page). The page number is specified in the LOC register.

field.title: Address
field.name: Address
field.description: This is the Address of the 1st page to read. Valid range depends on the memory size of the actual PICC
field.note: The number of pages to be read is deduced from the expected length, as set in the TOF register.

field.title: Shift Bytes
field.name: Shift Bytes
field.description: Leading bytes to suppress; valid range is `0` to `48` (in decimal).

field.title: Shift Bits
field.name: Shift Bits
field.description: Leading bits to suppress; valid range is `0` to `7`.

Transmit the sequence of bytes in reverse order
RAW Mode (Data is a numerical value)
String Mode (Data is an ASCII string)

field.name: Padding

Transmit the sequence of characters as is

register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

template.name: Mifare Classic
template.title: Mifare Classic Template
template.description: Use the Mifare Classic Template to read data from a NXP Mifare Classic PICC (Mifare Classic 1K, Mifare Classic 4K) or from any compliant PICCs (including Mifare Plus running in Security Level 14). The reader may either * Read arbitrary data; the data will be transmitted in hexadecimal format. To do so, select the RAW mode in TOF register. * Read a number (decimal output). To do so, select the decimal mode in TOF register. * Read a string (ASCII-encoded data). To do so, select either the Short String or the Long String mode in TOF register. The target data is pointed to by either: * A sector AID in the MAD (Mifare Access Directory) of the card, * An absolute block address. The AID or the block address is specified in the LOC register.

option.title: Transmit the sequence of bytes as is
Transmit the sequence of bytes in reverse order
RAW Mode (Data is a numerical value)
String Mode (Data is an ASCII string)

register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

register.title: Location of Data
register.remark: Reading can cross sector boundaries, but sector trailers are always discarded.

field.title: AID
field.name: AID
field.description: AID of the sector (MSB-first).
field.remark: Set to `0000` to specify an absolute address in the next byte.

field.title: Address
field.name: Address
field.description: This is the Address of the 1st block to read. Valid range depends on the memory size of the PICC (1K->64 blocks, 4K->256 blocks).
field.remark: Set to `00` to specify an AID in the previous bytes.

field.title: Shift Bytes
field.name: Shift Bytes
field.description: Leading bytes to suppress; valid range is `0` to `48` (in decimal).

field.title: Shift Bits
field.name: Shift Bits
field.description: Leading bits to suppress; valid range is `0` to `7`.

register.note: The number of blocks to be read is deduced from the expected length, as set in the TOF register.

register.title: Options
register.description: If this register is set, the Reader adds a token to its output to tell the receiver what kind of credential has been read.

field.name: Position of the Card Type Token

option.title: After the Prefix, before the Data

field.title: Add a Card Type Token to the output stream?
field.name: Card Type Token

option.title: Do not add a Card Type Token
Add `61` hex value as Card Type Token
Add `M` char as Card Type Token

field.title: Value of the CRYPTO1 Secret Key
field.description: The CRYPTO1 keys must be explicitly specified in the Templates.

template.name: Mifare Plus SL3
template.title: Mifare Plus SL3 Template
template.description: Use the Mifare Plus SL3 Template to read data from a NXP Mifare Plus PICC (Mifare Plus 2K, Mifare Plus 4K) running in Security Level 3. The reader may either * Read arbitrary data; the data will be transmitted in hexadecimal format. To do so, select the RAW mode in TOF register. * Read a number (decimal output). To do so, select the decimal mode in TOF register. * Read a string (ASCII-encoded data). To do so, select either the Short String or the Long String mode in TOF register. The target data is pointed to by either: * A sector AID in the MAD (Mifare Access Directory) of the card, * An absolute block address. The AID or the block address is specified in the LOC register.

register.title: Location of Data
register.remark: Reading can cross sector boundaries, but sector trailers are always discarded.

field.title: AID
field.name: AID
field.description: AID of the sector (MSB-first).
field.remark: Set to `0000` to specify an absolute address in the next byte.

field.title: Address
field.name: Address
field.description: This is the Address of the 1st block to read. Valid range depends on the memory size of the PICC (1K->64 blocks, 4K->256 blocks).
field.remark: Set to `00` to specify an AID in the previous bytes.

field.title: Shift Bytes

field.title: Shift Bits

register.note: The number of blocks to be read is deduced from the expected length, as set in the TOF register.

Read in plain, no MAC on command, MAC on response

template.name: ISO 15693 Memory
template.title: ISO 15693 Memory Template
template.description: Use the ISO 15693 Memory Template to read data from a VICC compliant with ISO 15693-3 or a NFC-V Tag (T5T). The reader may either * Read arbitrary data; the data will be transmitted in hexadecimal format. To do so, select the RAW mode in TOF register. * Read a number (decimal output). To do so, select the decimal mode in TOF register. * Read a string (ASCII-encoded data). To do so, select either the Short String or the Long String mode in TOF register. The target data is pointed to by an absolute block number (yet the data may occupy more than one block). According to the standard, the size of every block depends of the card (its a manufacturer's choice). Typical block sizes are 1, 2, 4 or 8 bytes. The reader accepts block sizes up to 64 bytes. The block number is specified in the LOC register.

field.title: Address
field.name: Address
field.description: This is the Address of the 1st page to read. Valid range depends on the memory size of the actual VICC
field.note: The number of pages to be read is deduced from the expected length, as set in the TOF register.

field.title: Shift Bytes
field.name: Shift Bytes
field.description: Leading bytes to suppress; valid range is `0` to `32` (in decimal).

field.title: Shift Bits
field.name: Shift Bits
field.description: Leading bits to suppress; valid range is `0` to `7`.

option.title: Transmit the sequence of bytes as is
Transmit the sequence of bytes in reverse order
RAW Mode (Data is a numerical value)
String Mode (Data is an ASCII string)

register.title: Prefix
register.description: A Template-specific Prefix, that is added after the Reader's global Prefix.
register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

template.name: EM4134 Memory
template.title: EM4134 Memory Template
template.description: Use the EM4134 Memory Template to read data from the EM MicroElectronic Marin EM4134 chip. The reader may either * Read arbitrary data; the data will be transmitted in hexadecimal format. To do so, select the RAW mode in TOF register. * Read a number (decimal output). To do so, select the decimal mode in TOF register. * Read a string (ASCII-encoded data). To do so, select either the Short String or the Long String mode in TOF register. The target data is pointed to by an absolute word number; a word is 4-byte long (yet the data may occupy more than one word). The word number is specified in the LOC register.

field.title: Address
field.name: Address
field.description: This is the Address of the 1st word to read; valid range is `1` to `15` (in decimal).
field.note: The number of words to be read is deduced from the expected length, as set in the TOF register.

field.title: Shift Bytes
field.name: Shift Bytes
field.description: Leading bytes to suppress; valid range is `0` to `3`.

field.title: Shift Bits
field.name: Shift Bits
field.description: Leading bits to suppress; valid range is `0` to `7`.

option.title: Transmit the sequence of bytes as is
Transmit the sequence of bytes in reverse order
RAW Mode (Data is a numerical value)
String Mode (Data is an ASCII string)

field.title: Padding if Data is shorted than specified length
field.name: Padding

option.title: Suppress `0` digits on the left of the Data
Transmit the sequence of characters as is
Transmit the sequence of characters in reverse order
RAW Mode (Data is a numerical value)
String Mode (Data is an ASCII string)

field.title: Padding if Data is shorted than specified length
field.name: Padding

option.title: Padd with ` ` (space characters) on the right until the specified length
Short string (truncate to 16 characters or less)

field.title: Options for Long String
field.name: Options for Long String
field.description: Use this byte to specify the exact length to read from the card. Valid range is `1` to `255`.

register.title: Options
register.description: If this register is set, the Reader adds a token to its output to tell the receiver what kind of credential has been read.

field.title: Position of the Card Type Token
field.name: Position of the Card Type Token

option.title: After the Prefix, before the Data

field.title: Add a Card Type Token to the output stream?
field.name: Card Type Token

option.title: Do not add a Card Type Token
Add `56` hex value as Card Type Token
Add `V` char as Card Type Token

register.title: Prefix
register.description: A Template-specific Prefix, that is added after the Reader's global Prefix.
register.remark: Use `\\t` for a Tab, `\\n` for Enter, `\\b` for Back space, `\\v` for Vertical space.

template.name: SpringBlue
template.title: SpringBlue Template
template.description: Read a credential from **SpringCard**'s SpringBlue mobile app.

template.name: Orange NFC Retail
template.title: Orange NFC Retail Template
template.description: Read an identifier from the Orange NFC Retail application running on a smartphone. Orange NFC APIs for Retail is a framework for NFC services, offered by Mobile Network Operator Orange. It targets loyalty, couponing and alike applications. The services rely on a general-purpose cardlet, loaded into a NFC-enabled smartphone's SIM card. Merchants and service providers are identified by a unique RetailerId (on 4 bytes). Every user belonging to this merchant or service provider is identified by either a unique HolderId (on 20 bytes), assigned by Orange to this very user, a CustomerId, defined freely by the merchant or service provider in association with a customer account, a LoyaltyId, defined freely by the merchant or service provider in association with a loyalty card or coupons.

template.name: Orange NFC Office
template.title: Orange NFC Office Template
template.description: Read an identifier from the Orange NFC Office application running on a smartphone. Use this template to read an identifier from the Orange NFC Office application running on a smartphone. Orange NFC APIs for Office is a framework for NFC services, offered by Mobile Network Operator Orange. It targets user identification applications (access control, private e-purse, car park & card sharing, and alikes). The services are provided by the smartphone either in host-based card emulation mode (HCE) or through a SIM card. Organisations are identified by an ApplicationId (variable length) and their organisation units by a ZoneId (on 6 bytes). A diversified AES key protects the data. Every user belonging to the organisation is identified by a Badge number on 10 bytes.

template.name: Apple VAS
template.title: Apple VAS Template
template.description: Read data from an iOS mobile phone using ECP and the Apple VAS protocol. On iOS, the Apple Wallet application allows users to organize their boarding passes, tickets, gift cards, and loyalty cards. Management of the passes is performed through the PassKit framework. NFC-enabled passes could be transmitted to a remote application through NFC, using the Apple Pay Value Added Services protocol (Apple VAS). Once configured using this template, a SpringCore Smart Reader is able to run the Apple VAS secure transaction on its own, and transmit the data in the plain to the host.
template.remark: As per Apple requirements, Apple VAS should only run on top of a NFC reader that implements the Apple VAS Enhanced Contactless Polling (ECP), which is an Apple-proprietary extension of EMV and ISO/IEC 14443-A (NFC-A). When configuring the Apple VAS template in the Smart Reader, always enable ECP in the "NFC-A specific options" configuration register and EMV compliance in the "NFC/RFID HF compliance in poller mode" configuration register. The SpringCore firmware is only suitable to read Apple Pay VAS data, not to run Apple Pay transactions. SpringCore devices are not payment terminals.

register.title: Merchant ID
register.description: Merchant ID of the 1st (or only) merchant. This is SHA256(*Merchant Name*).

register.title: Merchant URL
register.description: *Not used*.

field.title: Key slot in the internal ATECC

register.title: Merchant ID (second)
register.description: Merchant ID of the 2nd merchant. This is SHA256(*Merchant Name*).

register.title: Merchant URL (second)
register.description: *Not used*.

field.title: Key slot in the internal ATECC
